member.name: P:Acey.ExcelX.ICell.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets a formula of the cell.

remarks.p: A formula string always begins with an equal sign (=).
The following operator are supported:
a unaray-operator: +,-,%
a binary-operator: +, -, *, /, :, >, >=, ^, etc.
The following formula are supported:
[A] ABS, ACOS, ADDRESS, AND, ASIN, ATAN, AVEDEV, AVERAGE, AVERAGEA
[C] CEILING, CHOOSE, COLUMN, COLUMNS, COS, COSH, COUNT, COUNTA, COUNTBLANK
[D] DAY
[F] FALSE
[H] HOUR
[I] IF, ISBLANK, ISERR, ISERROR, ISLOGICAL, ISNA, ISNONTEXT, ISNUMBER, ISREF, ISTEXT
[M] MAX, MAXA, MEDIAN, MIN, MINA, MINUTE, MONTH
[N] NA, NOT, NOW
[O] OR
[P] PI, POWER
[R] ROUND, ROW, ROWS
[S] SECOND, SIGN, SIN, SINH, SQRT, SUM, SUMIF, SUMSQ, SUMPRODUCT
[T] TAN, TANH, TIME, TODAY, TRUE, TYPE
[Y] YEAR

member.exception: If parameters less than speicify function or parameters contains invalid value.

member.name: P:Acey.ExcelX.Charts.ISeries.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets series type.
member.remarks:
Remarks:
1.You cannot change the chart type to a stock chart. A stock chart requires three, four or five series of data plot a single point.
2.You cannot change the bubble type to a bubble chart. A bubble chart requires at least two value per data point.
3.If the chart type is 3-D chart type, you could not plot the series to the second axis.
4.A surface chart could not be combined with other chart types.

exception.p: 1.You cannot change the chart type to a stock chart. A stock chart requires three, four or five series of data plot a single point.
2.You cannot change the bubble type to a bubble chart. A bubble chart requires at least two value per data point.
3.If the chart type is 3-D chart type, you could not plot the series to the second axis.
4.A surface chart could not be combined with other chart types.

member.summary: Adds a name to the collection, or modifies the name if it already exists.

Specifies the formula to assign to the defined name.
member.returns: The created or modified defined name.

member.summary: Clears all of name in name collection.

member.summary: Removes the name of name object.

member.summary: Specifies the font family this font belongs to.

member.name: F:Acey.ExcelX.FontFamily.NotApplicable
member.summary: Dontcare Specifies a generic family name. This name is used when information about a font does not exist or does not matter. The default font is used.

member.name: F:Acey.ExcelX.FontFamily.Roman
member.summary: Roman Specifies a proportional font with serifs. An example is Times New Roman.

member.name: F:Acey.ExcelX.FontFamily.Swiss
member.summary: Swiss Specifies a proportional font without serifs. An example is Arial.

member.name: F:Acey.ExcelX.FontFamily.Modern
member.summary: Modern Specifies a monospace font with or without serifs. Monospace fonts are usually modern; examples include Pica, Elite, and Courier New.

member.name: F:Acey.ExcelX.FontFamily.Script
member.summary: Script Specifies a font that is designed to look like handwriting; examples include Script and Cursive.

member.name: F:Acey.ExcelX.FontFamily.Decorative
member.summary: Decorative Specifies a novelty font. An example is Old English.
